snippet: The rover Curiosity will end its eight-and-a-half-month journey from Earth on Sunday, after a series of computer-controlled maneuvers that NASA scientists can only watch.
abstract: NASA's Mars rover Curiosity will end its eight-and-a-half-month journey from Earth after a series of computer-controlled maneuvers that NASA scientists can only watch; confirmation of a successful touchdown could take several hours or even days.

byline.contributor: Michael Schwirtz contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The rover Curiosity will end its eight-and-a-half-month journey from Earth on Sunday, after a series of computer-controlled maneuvers that NASA scientists can only watch.

headline.seo: Fate of NASA’s Mars Mission Rests on Curiosity’s Landing
headline.main: Mars Mission’s Fate Rests on Landing
headline.print_headline: Mars Mission’s Fate Rests on Landing
